title: Definitions
context: ยง437D-3 Definitions. As used in this chapter: &ldquo;Advertisement&rdquo; means any oral, written, graphic, or pictorial statement or representation, including those made through any electronic or print medium. &ldquo;Advertisement&rdquo; does not include telephonic communications. &ldquo;Damage waiver&rdquo; means any contract or contractual provision, whether separate from or a part of a rental agreement, whereby the lessor agrees, for a charge, to waive any or all claims against the lessee for any damages to the rental motor vehicle during the term of the rental agreement. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of commerce and consumer affairs. &ldquo;Lessee&rdquo; means any person obtaining the use of a rental motor vehicle from a lessor for a period of six months or less under the terms of a rental agreement. &ldquo;Lessor&rdquo; means any person in the business of providing rental motor vehicles to the public. &ldquo;Plain language&rdquo; means language written or spoken in a clear and coherent manner using words with common and everyday meanings. &ldquo;Rental agreement&rdquo; means any written agreement setting forth the terms and conditions governing the use of the rental motor vehicle by the lessee. &ldquo;Rental cost&rdquo; means the daily or periodic rate charged for the use of the rental motor vehicle, but does not include optional or refueling charges. &ldquo;Rental motor vehicle&rdquo; or &ldquo;vehicle&rdquo; means a motor vehicle as defined in section 286-2, which is rented or leased or offered for rent or lease in this State, whether for personal or commercial use, for a period of six months or less.
